column3: INDICATOR:Indicator
column14: OBS_FOOTNOTE:Observation footnote
column16: DATA_SOURCE:Data Source
column17: SOURCE_LINK:Citation of or link to the data source
column19: TIME_PERIOD_METHOD:Time period activity related to when the data are collected
column21: COVERAGE_TIME:The period of time for which data are provided

column3: MG_RFGS_CNTRY_ORIGIN: Refugees, by country of origin
column14: Stateless and unknown origin refugees are only included in the global number. Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

column14: Stateless and unknown origin refugees are only included in the global number. Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

column14: Stateless and unknown origin refugees are only included in the global number. Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

column14: Stateless and unknown origin refugees are only included in the global number. Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

column14: Stateless and unknown origin refugees are only included in the global number. Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

column14: Stateless and unknown origin refugees are only included in the global number. Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

column14: Stateless and unknown origin refugees are only included in the global number. Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

column14: Stateless and unknown origin refugees are only included in the global number. Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

column14: Stateless and unknown origin refugees are only included in the global number. Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

column14: Stateless and unknown origin refugees are only included in the global number. Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.

column14: Stateless and unknown origin refugees are only included in the global number. Under 18 refugee population from years 2001 to 2020 is extrapolated using the known number of children and the total number of refugees. Only showing countries and regions with 50% or more coverage of age and sex. For years 2021 and later, under 18 population is estimated using the mean value of the the hierarchical Bayesian model performed by UNHCR.
column16: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees, Global Trends: Forced Displacement in 2023. UNHCR, 2024.
